title: Castello di Radda 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Subtle aromas of exotic spice, crushed herb and wild berry slowly unfold in the glass. The austere, medium-bodied palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate and star anise set against bright acidity and tightly knit, close-grained tannins. It needs time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2020–2033.

title: Château de Chatelard 2016 Cuvée les Vieux Granits  (Fleurie)
description: Planted on the granite soil typical of the region, the vines behind this wine give a textured, mineral character to the black fruits. That makes this a rich wine, although one that needs to be aged. Drink this concentrated wine from late 2018.

title: Château de la Terrière 2016 Cuvée de la Lure  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Deep tannins mark out this structured wine. A dense texture dominates the young black fruit. This will change, because the fruit is as powerful as the tannins. The wine will age well; drink from 2019.

title: Château Maucoil 2016 Trésor des Papes White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Fresh lemon, grapefruit and apple flavors are embellished with decadent swirls of vanilla, spice and cream in this lavish white blend. It's silky smooth, almost creamy, in texture, but balanced neatly by sunny tangerine acidity and hints of dusty minerals.

title: Domaine Anita 2016 Reine de Nuit  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Harvested at night to keep freshness, this wine comes from 35-year-old vines. It has a fruity character, bright with red-cherry acidity and a rounded, smooth texture. The edge of tannins and intense acidity make it a food wine. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Les Charmes  (Morgon)
description: Schist rocks in the Les Charmes vineyard give this wine its rich mineral character. Along with that are tannins both from the fruit and the wood aging, making this a rich wine that needs to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine de Colette 2016 Le Mont  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Owner Jacky Gauthier has produced a rich wine from low-yielding vines. The tannins and dark, firm texture are both rich and well placed to support the black-plum and berry fruits. This ripe wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine de la Voûte des Crozes 2016  Côte de Brouilly
description: Old vines and 10 months in wood have given this wine both concentration and great elegance. Ripe berry fruits have been smoothed by hints of toast, balanced acidity and ripe tannins. Drink this wine from mid-2018.
winery: Domaine de la Voûte des Crozes

title: Domaine de Nalys 2013 Réserve Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Earthy, gamy notes accentuate muted tones of strawberry leather and dried plum in this rustic but elegant wine. Ripe and rich on the palate, it extends long through a delicately tannic, cocoa-dusted finish.

title: Domaine des Capréoles 2016 Sous la Croix  (Régnié)
description: Ripe black fruits and generous tannins give this wine richness and dense texture. It is aged for seven months in wood, adding a caramel and toast character to the generous fruit. The wine is packed with fruit and ready to drink.

title: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2016  Moulin-à-Vent
description: Aged in large wooden barrels, this wine is dense, with a firm texture and juicy, crisp black-currant fruit. Bright acidity gives a lively aftertaste, although the structure remains firm and the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Matray 2016 Aux Thèpes  (Saint-Amour)
description: The 55-year-old vines behind this wine have produced a rich wine. Still-dense tannins mark it out as youthful and needing to age further. It will do this well, broadening out the red-berry fruits and increasing the density of the wine. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 Cuvée Piron-Lameloise  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Richly fruity, this wine is dense, structured and impressive. Ripe black fruits and strong tannins will allow it to age. The property was purchased by Dominique Piron from leading restaurateurs, the Lameloise family. Drink from 2019.

title: Eder 2016 Ried Silberbichl Smaragd Sauvignon Blanc (Wachau)
description: This wine's grassy notes of fresh, green foliage grow richer with air, but thast green, vivid freshness remains on the palate. Lime and lemon freshness pervades the slender palate, giving it verve. The finish is dry and has more grassy intensity.

title: Emiliana 2014 Coyam Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Compact plum and currant aromas are floral at first then more spicy and foxy as this blend led by Syrah and Carmenère airs out. A tough palate flush with tannins deals spicy, herbal plum flavors with ample chocolate and spice from oak. On the finish, this dries out and tastes peppery. Drink through 2022.

title: Empire Estate 2016 Reserve Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Intense aromas of ripe peach, tangerine, ginger and white blossoms meld with underscores of slate and smoke in this project from Thomas Pastuszak, wine director at The NoMad. This powerful wine displays rich fruit, floral and spice notes on the palate, with enough acidity to maintain balance. The finish carries on and on in apricot and orchard blossom tones. A perfect match for pork or fowl.

title: Erasmo 2011 Reserva de Caliboro Red (Maule Valley)
description: Toasty oak and savory cherry and plum aromas are meaty and calm. On the palate, this is linear and compact, with a beam of acidity that keeps things healthy and plodding ahead. Spicy oak flavors blend nicely with tomato, herbal plum and red currant notes. Drink now through 2024.

title: Erasmo 2013 Reserva de Caliboro Red (Maule Valley)
description: Dry earthy aromas of black fruits are subtle and calm, not loud, oaky or overtly herbal or spicy. A bit of clamp is found on a firm palate, while this Bordeaux blend tastes of spicy, lightly herbal plum and berry fruits. A steady thorough finish feels right. Drink through 2022.

title: Ernie Els 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)
description: While this is currently slightly tight and closed, it shows the structure and elements to present a complete and well-balanced wine with a little time. Scents of charred plum skin, dark chocolate, cigar box and roast beef dance in the bouquet, while the bold, firm palate offers flavors of black fruit skin, cassis and char. Drink 2019–2022.

title: Forstreiter 2016 Schiefer Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: The merest hint of passion fruit gives this wine's nose a tropical twist. The palate still has some sprightly fizz, combining earthy, soy-like savory texture with pithy citrus notes. It's slender in body and finishes on a dry, refreshing note.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de la Vigne Romaine  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This estate is named for the Romans who originally planted vines here. With touches of wood aging giving spice and toast along with rich, juicy black-plum fruits, this is a wine to age. It will be best from 2019.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This wine has a smoky character that lies over the juicy fruit, adding extra interest and texture to this already structured wine. With solid tannins and rich red-plum and cherry fruit, this wine is still developing. Drink from late 2018.

title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Domaine des Versauds  (Morgon)
description: This rich, structured wine is full of both ripe tannins and generous fruit. It is dense, as befits a Morgon, while also having a layer of juicy red-berry fruits. The structure and acidity promise aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Kohl 2015 Kohloss Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: Fragrant plum and red cherry notes have an alluring hint of cinnamon. The palate retains these rich, aromatic flavors but presents them on a fresh, slender canvas that shows both fruit and spice. Lovely and highly appetizing.

title: KWV 2015 Cathedral Cellar Cabernet Sauvignon (Western Cape)
description: Earthy mint and blackcurrant leaf aromas sit atop the rich, concentrated black-fruit core of this wine. The medium-weight palate offers bold blackberry, cassis and boysenberry flavors, framed by firm yet well-integrated tannins that provide a crushed-velvet texture. Notes of berry compote, dried fynbos, green peppercorn and roast beef all unfold on the lingering, layered finish. Drink now–2021.

title: Landmark 2015 Overlook Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County-Sonoma County-Monterey County)
description: Aromas of roasted red cherry, sharp black raspberry and herb-tinged smoked pork in mulberry sauce make for a mouthwatering entry to this bottling. The oak is strong on the palate, giving a vanilla overlay to the cranberry and rose petal flavors. A hint of juniper shows on the finish.

title: Las Niñas 2014 Premium Made With Organic Grapes Red (Apalta)
description: This Syrah-Mourvèdre-Cabernet Sauvignon from the Apalta subzone of the Colchagua Valley deals spicy aromas of road tar and black plum. A tight integrated palate is firm more than luxe, while nicely merged cassis, plum and oak flavors add up to quality. Rich flavors of tobacco and chocolaty oak bolster a long finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Les Frères Perroud 2015 Améthyste  (Brouilly)
description: This rich wine is full bodied, structured and, for a bottling from this appellation, packed with tannins. At the same time, the fruit shines through the wine's dry core, giving black plum and cherry flavors as well as acidity. The wine will develop further, so drink from late 2018.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2015 Southworth Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Bright, focused acidity flirts with the medium-bodied palate that boasts flavors of lemon and grapefruit. A background of supportive oak never gets in the way, offering complementing tones of nutmeg and vanilla.

title: Mi Sueño 2014 Syrah (Napa Valley)
description: This is a soft oaky wine that builds power and concentration as it opens and expands on the palate, showing brawn and plenty of body. Juicy blackberry is lifted by integrated acidity and welcome jolts of black pepper.
